## Objetivo
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18243`.

## Pistas
- What is e generally?

## Solución
```
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/Documents/Retos/miniRSA/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18243
c: 
n: 
e: 
                                                                                                                    
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/Documents/Retos/miniRSA/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ python3
Python 3.9.8 (main, Nov  7 2021, 15:47:09) 
[GCC 11.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> c = 
>>> n = 
>>> d = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> m = pow(c,d,n)
>>> m

>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'\\\xef\xc5)\x9eSc\xc2\xf1E\xbc\xe7)n\x8d5Dy;\xb8\xd3\xfb\xe8z\xaa\xa9\xa9/\x82mFP\x10pP\xd5\xfc$\x86eQ\xdce\xb4\x15\xb9W\xee\xf8\xcf\xdaR\x10B\x8e\xfe\x0f\xc7\xa7\x90r\n\x9a\x86\x9au\x8b\xfd\xe9\x85\xab\xcc\xa6K}\xf4h\x16\x8e`Y4-\xf9eO\r\xda\x01K\x80W\xb4\xf6+\xd5\xcaF\x9f\xa1Z_\xd1\xdc\xfbS\xf0G\xf4\xe9\xd7\xab\xa4c\xd2\x10\x1e\xde\xd4(\x19\xf4OT\xd2\xfe\x1f\xfa'
>>> m = pow(c,e,n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653466129492033745533
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_4783252}'


Flag: picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_4783252}
```
